title: MCP Tools Not Accessible - Missing Personal Access Token
symptoms: MCP tools like list_tables return 'No such tool available'
execute_sql, create_issue, send_message tools not accessible
Claude Code can't access any MCP functionality
API calls work directly but MCP tools don't

root_cause.details: MCP servers require specific Personal Access Tokens (different from API keys) to start. Without proper tokens, MCP servers fail to initialize, making all tools unavailable.
root_cause.specific_missing: SUPABASE_ACCESS_TOKEN in .mcp.json had placeholder instead of real token

wrong_paths_taken: Testing MCP gateway on various ports
Assuming it was a tool naming issue

solution.description: Fixed MCP configuration by correcting placeholder syntax from {{}} to ${} format and adding missing API key placeholders to .env file. Xero credentials were corrected to use proper environment variable syntax. Added empty placeholders for OPENAI_API_KEY, GOOGLE_API_KEY, LINEAR_API_KEY, and BRAVE_API_KEY. MCP configuration now properly references environment variables.

mandatory_checks: Include MCP verification in startup checks
Run verify-mcp-ready.js on every session start
prevention.documentation: Create MCP_TOKEN_REQUIREMENTS.md with all token requirements

impact.user_experience: Complete inability to use MCP tools despite them being configured

lessons_learned: MCP servers have different authentication requirements than direct APIs
Personal Access Tokens are different from API keys
Always verify token configuration, not just presence
MCP servers must start successfully for tools to be available
user_quote: Why the fuck are they not accessible in the current session?
